Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant that has enough water, showing how it looks healthy and strong.
The student can draw a plant that does not have water, showing how it looks weak or wilted.
The student can illustrate the difference in appearance between a plant with water and a plant without water.
The student can include a bright sun in their drawing to show that plants need light to grow well.
The student can depict any changes over time if a plant does not receive water.
